text: Encodes any string into a valid variable or geometry attribute name.

Houdini geometry attributes and group names are only allowed to contain
letters, numbers, and underscores, and must not begin with a number. This
function takes any string, and encodes it into a string that obeys these
restrictions. The original string can be recovered using the

function.
A string that already obeys the rules is returned unmodified.
One exception to this rule is that a string starting with

will be
encoded even if it is already a valid attribute name. This is because
is the prefix used to identify an encoded string. In this case, an additional

prefix will be added. This means a string can be encoded any number of
times, then decoded the same number of times to always return to the original
string, regardless of its contents.

summary: Encodes any string into a valid variable or geometry attribute name.
title: encode
